prompt: Facts: Marriage between the deceased (Bibi Tarannum Khatoon) and Md. Allauddin (absconding accused) took place approximately 1.5 years prior to the incident.; Allegations existed that the deceased was subjected to cruelty and torture by her husband, mother-in-law (Bibi Parwana Khatoon - Appellant No. 1), and sister-in-law (Bibi Jannat Khatoon - Appellant No. 2) for non-fulfillment of dowry demands (Rs. 10,000 cash and a Hero Honda motorcycle).; Incident occurred on 19.07.1999 around 10:00 AM at Village Chainpur, P.S. Muffasil, District West Champaran, Bihar.; The deceased was allegedly set on fire after kerosene oil was poured on her by the accused.; FIR was lodged on 19.07.1999 at 14:30 hours by Md. Nasim Akhtar (PW-3, brother of the deceased) based on his 'fardbeyan' recorded at M.J.K. Hospital, Bettiah.; A dying declaration was recorded by the Judicial Magistrate, Bettiah (PW-9) on 19.07.1999 at 2:15 PM.; In the dying declaration, the deceased implicated her mother-in-law (poured kerosene), sister-in-law (lit the matchstick), and husband (caught hold of her), stating the motive was non-fulfillment of dowry demands.; A medical certificate confirmed the deceased was fit to make the statement when the dying declaration was recorded.; Post-mortem examination conducted by Dr. B.N. Prasad (PW-8) revealed 100% burn injuries, with the cause of death stated as shock due to extensive burns.; The Trial Court convicted both appellants (mother-in-law and sister-in-law) under Sections 304B and 498A IPC, sentencing them to 10 years RI and 3 years RI respectively, to run concurrently.; The High Court of Patna dismissed the appellants' appeal and confirmed the Trial Court's judgment.; The present appeal was filed before the Supreme Court by the convicted mother-in-law and sister-in-law. | IPC: Section 304B (Dowry Death), Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), Section 34 (Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention - implicitly applied)
